refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Ensures that the current working thread is attached to the Java VM. It operates as follows:

itemizedlist.listitem: if the Java VM is not created it creates it.
if the java VM is running, but the current working thread is not attached as a Java VM thread it attaches it.
if none of the above it returns.

refsect1.para: The java_vm_attach() function is called implicitly in each of the other VSEs, and also when allocating, copying or deleting a Virtuoso/PL reference to a Java VM object values.

If the Java VM is already initialized and the classpath is supplied it will throw a SQL error. If the Java VM is not initialized, but it is required to execute a statement the server will implicitly call java_vm_attach (NULL);. The Virtuoso Java VM integration binary works with JDK 1.2 and later.

refsect2.title: classpath
refsect2.para: The classpath string to be supplied to the Java VM. If classpath is NULL the server OS environment variable CLASSPATH will be used instead.

refsect2.title: vm_options
refsect2.para: A vector of name/value pairs for the Java VM initialization parameters. The format and values of the parameters is described in the JNI Enhancements Introduced in version 1.2 of the JavaTM 2 SDK document - the description of JNI_CreateJavaVM Invocation API function.

example.title: Initializing the Java VM
example.para: This example initializes the Java VM by supplying a classpath of: CLASSPATH=/usr/local/virtuoso/classes:/usr/local/jakarta-tomcat-3.3.1/lib/tomcat.jar and sets the tomcat.home Java system property to /usr/local/jakarta-tomcat-3.3.1 It is the equivalent of executing JDK/JRE 1.2 unix java tool using: java -cp /usr/local/virtuoso/classes:/usr/local/jakarta-tomcat-3.3.1/lib/tomcat.jar -Dtomcat.home=/usr/local/jakarta-tomcat-3.3.1
